root.description: Bethesda LawsuitIn August 2011, lawyers on behalf of Zenimax Media, the parent company of Bethesda Softworks, threatened Mojang with legal action, claiming that the title "Scrolls" could cause confusion with Bethesda's upcoming title, The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim. Markus "Notch" Persson, founder of Mojang AB, responded with a (supposedly) serious offer to settle the matter with a Mojang-vs.-Bethesda match in Quake III: Arena. Bethesda did not agree to a Quake match, but the two parties did settle out of court. Mojang retained the right to name their game "Scrolls" but gave Bethesda the trademark.
